Remarks/Remarques: A large rain event on 2021-11-15 resulted in significant degradation of the material at the confluence of Mamquam River and Ring Creek. This scour event altered the stage-discharge relationship at the Mamquam River gauging location. Curve #35.00 was developed using the measurements from 2022-2023 and meant to be a median, best fit curve to pivot from. Curve #35.00 is active from the receding limb of the 2021-11-15 rain event where the resulting discharge is equivalent to the discharge produced by curve #34.00. The upper end of the curve is based on the 2012 high water measurement and the estimation grade is based on the 1990 high water measurement. The low-end estimation grade is based on the 1997 low water measurement.
Curve re-defined significantly following high water event in 2015
